champ.champInfo:
The general management of the competitions is carried out by the Department of Youth and Sports Kamian City Council. The direct organization and conduct of the competition relies on management of the public organization "Sports Club Kyokushin Karate-do "Busin-kan", organizing committee and the panel of judges appointed for this competition.

Organizing committee and judges:

  • The chief judge of the competition is the President of the public organization "Sports Club Kyokushin Karate-do "Busin-kan" R.V. Kashira (3 dan)
  • The supreme observer of the competition is the representative (Branch Chief) of the Kyokushin-kan Karate-do international organization in Ukraine, Shikhan Shchygolev Andriy Olegovich (5 dan)
  • Technical support â€” Tatarchenko I.Yu. (Lviv)

Venue of the competition: Kamianske, sports complex "SK Prometheus" (Anoshkina Ave., 109)

The competition will be held in Kamianske on February 3, 2024.

Competition program

February 2 (Friday): 14.00 - 16.00 judges' seminar

February 3 (Saturday):

  • 08:00 - 09:00 room preparation
  • 09:00 - 09:30 registration of participants in the "kata" section, judges' meeting
  • 09:30 - 09:45 welcome speech and explanation of the rules of the "kata" competition
  • 09:45 - 11:30 tatami 1/ qualifying and final round of "kata" performances
  • 11:30 - 12:00 awarding of winners in the "kata" section
  • 12:00 - 12:30 technical break
  • 12:30 - 17:00 tatami 1,2/ qualifying and final matches
  • 17:00 - 18:00 awarding of winners and closing of the competition

Competition rules.

  • Competitions are held according to the rules established and approved by the Kyokushin-kan International organization and according to the Rules approved by the Ministry of Family, Youth and Sports of Ukraine for 2024.
  • Competitions in the "kata" section are held (among men and among women) - 1/4 final, final
  • Competitions in the "kumite" section are held according to the Olympic system with elimination after defeat
  • If the athlete does not appear on the tatami after the announcement of his name or the start of the fight is delayed for other reasons for more than 1 minute, the athlete is considered defeated
  • Athletes who were disqualified during the competition do not take part in the following matches
  • Athletes whose actual weight does not correspond to the weight category in the application are defeated and do not take part in the next matches
  • Athletes who use protective equipment that does not comply with the requirements of the Regulation receive a notice of CHUI ICHI
  • In the event of controversial issues regarding the results of matches, the final decision is made by the chief judge of the competition

Categories of participants:

KATA:
Age Gender Degree 1st circle 2nd circle
6 - 7 Boys/ Girls 0 - 11 kyu Taikioku sono ichi Taikioku sono no
6 - 7 Boys/ Girls 10 - 9 kyu Taikioku sono ichi Taikioku sono san
8 - 9 Boys/ Girls 0 - 11 kyu Taikioku sono ichi Taikioku sono no
8 - 9 Boys/ Girls 10 - 9 kyu Taikioku sono ichi Taikioku sono san
10 - 11 Boys/ Girls 0 - 9 kyu Taikioku sono ichi Taikioku sono san
12 - 13 Boys/ Girls 0 - 9 kyu Taikioku sono ichi Taikioku sono san
14 - 15 Boys/ Girls 0 - 9 kyu Taikioku sono ichi Taikioku sono san
  • After the first round, 5 athletes (the number of participants is more than 8 people) or 4 athletes (the number of participants is less than 8 people) who scored higher points and go to the second round
  • Three winners are revealed in the second round (1st, 2nd, 3rd place)
  • The starting score in the 1st round is 6
  • The starting score in the 2nd round is 7
Kumite:
Age Gender Weight categories
6-7 Young men -20 -25 -30 -35 +35
6-7 Girls -20 -25 -30 -35 +35
8-9 Young men -25 -30 -35 -40 +40
8-9 Girls -25 -30 -35 -40 +40
10-11 Young men -30 -35 -40 -45 +45
10-11 Girls -30 -35 -40 -45 +45
12-13 Young men -35 -40 -45 -50 +55
12-13 Girls -35 -40 -45 -50 +50
14-15 Young men -45 -50 -55 -60 +60
14-15 Girls -40 -45 -50 -55 +55
Scheme of matches
  • Children: boys and girls (6-7 years old):
    • qualifying matches - 1 min. + 1 min.
    • Semifinal and final matches: 1 min. + 1 min. + weighing + 1 min. /The difference in weight is 2 kg/.
  • Children: boys and girls (8-9 years old):
    • qualifying matches - 1.5 min. + 1 min.
    • Semifinal and final matches: 1.5 min. + 1 min. + weighing + 1 min. /The difference in weight is 2 kg/.
  • Children: boys and girls (10-11 years):
    • qualifying matches - 1.5 min. + 1 min.
    • Semifinal and final matches: 1.5 min. + 1 min. + weighing + 1 min. /The difference in weight is 2 kg/.
  • Children: boys and girls (12-13 years old):
    • qualifying matches - 1.5 min. + 1.5 min.
    • Semifinal and final matches: 1.5 min. + 1.5 min. + weighing + 1 min. /The difference in weight is 2.5 kg/.
  • Boys and girls (14-15 years old):
    • qualifying matches - 2 min. + 2 min.
    • Semifinal and final matches: 2 min. + 2 min. + weighing + 1 min. /The difference in weight is 2.5 kg/.

Financing

Expenses for the organization and holding of the competition are related to the rent of the premises, food the board of judges and the purchase of award paraphernalia are provided by the public by the organization "Busin-kan Kyokushin Karate-do Sports Club", as well as at the expense of others extrabudgetary revenues. Travel expenses in both directions, accommodation, food, per diem trainers and participants are provided by the sending organizations.Financial terms of participation in competitions are indicated in the appendix to the Regulation

Awards

  • Athletes who took 1-3 places are awarded with cups, medals, diplomas of the respective degrees

Registration

Registration for participation in the competition takes place through a personal account until January 28, 2024. Or to the e-mail of the organizing committee:

Tatarchenkoiu@ukr.net
Ihor Tatarchenko tel. +38(067) 788-77-28

rkashira1@gmail.com
Chief judge of Kashira Roman, tel. +38(097) 541-38-58

Assistant to the chief judge on technical issues Bohdan Korkh, phone: +38(097) 045-13-48

The final originals of applications for participation in the competition together with documents that confirm the application data (passports, birth certificate) or personal applications of the participants, necessarily certified by a physical education dispensary, together with an insurance policy, budo passport (certificate or qualification book of the athlete), submitted by the official representative of the team in mandate committee until 09.00 on February 3, 2024. Lately submitted or incorrectly completed applications are not considered
